hallFameCase.name: Hall of Fame Cases
hallFameCase.description:
The Hall of Fame is the centerpiece of the first floor and will showcase Stetson University’s rich 
 athletic history. Glass trophy cases will highlight individual sports programs, Hall of Fame 
 inductees and student-athlete achievements. A touch screen videoboard will familiarize touring 
 prospective students and student-athletes with Stetson’s championship history. Alumni and 
 fans of Stetson can relive their greatest Hatter athletic moments while sharing stories in the 
 Hall of Fame lounge

hallFameDisplay.name: Hall of Fame Display
hallFameDisplay.description:
The Hall of Fame is the centerpiece of the first floor and will showcase Stetson University’s rich 
 athletic history. Glass trophy cases will highlight individual sports programs, Hall of Fame 
 inductees and student-athlete achievements. A touch screen videoboard will familiarize touring 
 prospective students and student-athletes with Stetson’s championship history. Alumni and 
 fans of Stetson can relive their greatest Hatter athletic moments while sharing stories in the 
 Hall of Fame lounge

lounge.name: Lounge
lounge.description:
This multi-purpose space can be used as a classroom or meeting space, or for receptions and 
 catered events. It will also be used as a hospitality area during athletic events for premium seat 
 donors and season ticketholders. The VIP room will serve as one of the larger meeting spaces 
 on campus, with similar functionality and use as the Stetson Room in the Carlton Union Building 
 (CUB).

cafe.name: Cafe Concessions Area
cafe.description: Event patrons will visit the café for concessions on busy game days.

retail.name: Retail
retail.description: Stetson fans can choose from the latest and greatest Hatter apparel.

ticketing.name: Ticketing
ticketing.description: Thousands of patrons each year will visit the ticketing area.

lobby.name: Lobby
lobby.description:
The impressive glass façade to the building will allow the lobby and Hall of Fame to be visible 
 from the street. The main lobby is multi-use, providing a lounge area with furniture for staff, 
 coaches and students to congregate and study. For non-athletic events, the lobby is a place for 
 attendees to congregate before or after an event and is spacious enough to be used as a 
 reception area. For athletic events, the lobby features a concession stand (café) and 
 merchandise display. The furniture can be relocated to accommodate a stanchion for the 
 concession stand line.

balcony.name: VIP Balcony Seating
balcony.description:
The new balcony provides a VIP-level view to the action on the court, while providing free-flow 
 access to the VIP room.

athletic_suite.name: Athletic Director Suite
athletic_suite.description:
This new suite provides ample space for the Athletic Director and more staff to more efficiently 
 function on a daily basis, improving communications and overall operations. The current office 
 layout is outdated with non-adjacent small offices. The suite and lounge will welcome alumni, 
 donors, prospective student-athletes and families.

vip_room.name: VIP Room
vip_room.description:
This multi-purpose space can be used as a classroom or meeting space, or for receptions and 
 catered events. It will also be used as a hospitality area during athletic events for premium seat 
 donors and season ticketholders. The VIP room will serve as one of the larger meeting spaces 
 on campus, with similar functionality and use as the Stetson Room in the Carlton Union Building 
 (CUB).

head_coach.name: Head Coach Offices
head_coach.description:
The head coach offices for the men’s and women’s basketball teams are located in close 
 proximity. Sharing a suite with their other staff professionalizes and increases the efficiency of 
 our operations while providing a welcoming space for visitors.

basketball_suite.name: Basketball Suite
basketball_suite.description:
Home to the basketball coaching staffs, this suite unites currently non-adjacent staff. It 
 professionalizes and increases the efficiency of our operations while providing an impressive 
 space for prospective student-athletes and their families as well as alumni.
